definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: It is the great who is assailed by envy.
sentences.chinese: 正是大人物才受到嫉妒的中伤。

sentences.english: Wanting to do him dirt, she sent his wife a poison-pen letter.
sentences.chinese: 施诡计就写了一封恶意中伤的信给他的妻子。

sentences.english: A true friend stabs you in the front.
sentences.chinese: 真朋侪才会当面中伤定位。

sentences.english: Their whole political life has been about a rough and tumble campaign, " she said.
sentences.chinese: 他们的整个政治生活中一直面临着种种造谣中伤。

sentences.english: Slander , the viper , has wrongfully accused me.
sentences.chinese: 谣言这条毒蛇对我进行了恶意中伤。

sentences.english: I gave my ear to what I now know was the malice of slander .
sentences.chinese: 我过去听信了谣言，现在我知道那是恶意中伤。

sentences.english: He doesn't care about scandals, slanders, calumnies, aspersions, or defamation.
sentences.chinese: 他不在乎流言蜚语，诽谤，中伤。

sentences.english: Sometimes it's difficult to draw a line between backbiting and malicious gossip.
sentences.chinese: 有时很难区分诽谤和恶意中伤。

sentences.english: In the court, he thought the charges were slanderous rumours.
sentences.chinese: 在法庭上，他认为对他的指控是造谣中伤。

sentences.english: You'd better not to file a lawsuit for his backbiting .
sentences.chinese: 你最好不要为他中伤你而对他提出诉讼。

sentences.english: She slandered him behind his back.
sentences.chinese: 她在背地里对他造谣中伤。

sentences.english: This lady might have thought injurious without being explicit.
sentences.chinese: 这位夫人可能会认为是一种隐晦曲折的中伤。

sentences.english: At least Beijing don't go around slandering and defaming others.
sentences.chinese: 至少，北京不会四处诽谤和中伤别人。

sentences.english: But much of the venom in the press, at any rate, is directed at big multinationals.
sentences.chinese: 然，媒体的许多恶意中伤，矛头直指大的跨国公司。

sentences.english: Mr Thomas is used to brickbats.
sentences.chinese: 托马斯已习惯于旁人的言语中伤。

to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb

to attack sb by exposing faults/to denounce
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
to start rumours and create trouble
to attack someone by innuendo (idiom)/to make oblique charges/to make insinuations/to insinuate
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
